topic.title: FlexE Group, Subgroup and Client Provisioning API Details

body.p: The flowchart for provisioning FlexE Groups, Subgroups and Clients is shown in Figure 1 below and uses the API shown in Table 1.

note.p: The source file for the following diagram can be found at http://bby1dms01.pmc-sierra.internal/DocMgmt/getfile.cfm?file_id=444764 (sheet "FlexE_Provision")

fig.title: FlexE Groups, Subgroups and Clients Provisioning Flowchart

table.title: FlexE Groups, Subgroups and Clients Provisioning API

entry.p: Initiates collection of a FlexE group's configuration
Adds a single FlexE PHY into a FlexE Group
Assigns one or more FlexE PHY for a FlexE Group to a (sub)group
Provisions and activates a bi-directional FlexE group
Used to provision a FlexE client to a FlexE group
Used to switch the calendars for the FlexE Group to add/remove FlexE clients

section.title: g5_api_flexe_group_prov()
section.p: The g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API initiates collection of a FlexE group's configuration. It has the following parameters and associated enumerated types:

The device_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API is the device instance.The chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API is a user specified channel ID for FlexE Group. This is not the same as the 20-bit FlexE Group number that used to specify the "FlexE Group Number" in the FlexE overhead as there is no guarantee that the FlexE Group numbers will be unique in the network. This is a unique channel ID used to identify a FlexE group on each device.
The mode parameter of Â the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API chooses the FlexE mode via the g5_flexe_mode_t enumeration shown in Table 2 below.

entry.p: A FlexE Group with each FlexE PHY connected to a 100GE physical port. FlexE clients may be terminated to ILKN PKT interface or ODUk/ODUFlex transported through mapper path.

A FlexE Group with the set of FlexE PHY transported over one or more ODUFlex (sub)groups using G.709 17.12 mapping procedure. FlexE Clients within the FlexE Group may be terminated to ILKN PKT interface.
A FlexE Group with each FlexE PHY transported over OTN using ODU4 GMP mapping. FlexE Client within the FlexE Group may be terminated to ILKN PKT interface.

A FlexE Group with each FlexE PHY connected to a 100GE physical port. The FlexE PHY making up the FlexE group are assigned to one or more (sub)groups and the subgroups are transparently transported over OTN using G.709 17.12 mapping procedure. There is no access to FlexE Clients in this operating mode.

section.p: The flexe_group_number_tx and flexe_group_number_rx parameters of the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API are a 20 bit field that chooses the FlexE group number that mapped to the 'FlexE Group Number' overhead field in Block #1 bit 12-31 of FlexE overhead.
The last parameter of the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API is the enumeration g5_flexe_calendar_mode_t. FlexE calendar modes are shown in Table 3 below.

entry.p: FlexE_MUX acts as a 'master' by initiating the calendar configuration. The calendar configurations are transmitted from the FlexE_MUX to the FlexE_DEMUX where FlexE_DEMUX acts as a 'slave' of the far end FlexE_MUX. FlexE_DEMUX calendar locations are not known until the far end FlexE_MUX advertises them. If the timer expires upon switching the calendars, force the switch and continue.

FlexE_MUX acts as a 'master' by initiating the calendar configuration. The calendar configurations are transmitted from the FlexE_MUX to the FlexE_DEMUX where FlexE_DEMUX acts as a 'slave' of the far end FlexE_MUX. FlexE_DEMUX calendar locations are not known until the far end FlexE_MUX advertises them. If the timer expires upon switching the calendars, return an alarm to the application layer, do not perform the switch and await for the application layer to proceed with next steps.
A and B calendar configurations are fixed and always uses the A calendar configuration as the calendar configuration in use.

A network management system owns the Near End and Far End FlexE_MUX and FlexE_DEMUX nodes. The network management system configures the FlexE_MUX and FlexE_DEMUX calendars directly and controls both ends when to switch calendars.

section.title: g5_api_flexe_phy_add()
section.p: The g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API adds a single FlexE PHY into a FlexE Group. A FlexE Group can have maximum 6 PHYs. To add more than one PHY in a FlexE Group, this function needs to be called multiple times. When the FlexE Group is provisioned all calendar slots of a PHY will report unused or unavailable. Note the PHYs are to be added in the logical PHY order within the group. The g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API has the following parameters and associated enumerated types:
The device_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API is the device instance.The chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API the channel ID for this FlexE PHY.

The serdes_port_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API is the SERDES port ID for the FlexE PHY. If there is no physical SERDES interface, serdes_port_id is set to the reserved value, G5_FLEXE_SERDES_UNUSED. This reserved value is used for G5_FLEXE_MODE_OTN_AWARE(FlexE Terminated Aware) and G5_FLEXE_MODE_OTN_UNAWARE modes.
The group_chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API is the channel ID assigned to the FlexE Group this PHY is being added to.

The flexe_phy_number_tx parameter of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API is an 8 bit PHY number that is expected in the 'PHY Number' overhead field in Block #2 bits 9-16 of the FlexE overhead. For transmit path, this number is used to set corresponding bits in the 'PHY Map' overhead field in Block #2 bit 1-8 of the FlexE overhead. The OH PHY number valid range 1-254.

The num_unavailable_slots_tx and num_unavailable_slots_rx parameters of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API are the number of unavailable calendar slots within the PHY. If the FlexE group is carrying a FlexE client to MAPOTN using G.709 17.12 Aware mapping, the number of unavailable slots can be asymmetric in transmit and receive direction on a particular PHY. The total number of unavailable slots in a FlexE group must be the same in both transmit and receive directions as MAPOTN does not support asymmetric uni-directional bandwidth configuration. Configured with multiples of 5 (0, 5, 10, or 15).

The flexe_phy_number_rx parameter of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API is an 8 bit PHY number that is expected in the 'PHY Number' overhead field in Block #2 bits 9-16 of FlexE overhead. For Rx, this number is used to check for match against the transmit PHY number from the Far End FlexE Mux.

The SERDES port selection options are provided by the enumeration g5_serdes_pin_mode_t of the pin_mode parameter of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API. The enumerator G5_SERDES_PIN_MODE_NRZ configures the SERDES port for rates up to 28 Gbps. The enumerator G5_SERDES_PIN_MODE_PAM4_ADJ configures the SERDES port for 56 Gbps.
The last parameter of the g5_api_flexe_phy_add() API is fec that uses the enumeration g5_enet_fec_mode_t. The mode choices are as follows:

li.p: No FEC as selected by the enumerator G5_ENET_FEC_MODE_NONE where FEC mode is disabled and no processing is done.
Reed Solomon KR4 (528, 514) FEC correction as selected by the enumerator G5_ENET_FEC_REED_SOLOMON_KR4 where KR4 FEC mode is enabled.

section.title: g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add()
section.p: The g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add() API assigns one or more FlexE PHY for a FlexE Group to a (sub)group. A FlexE group can be broken down into m (m = 1-6) (sub)groups where m must be less than or equal to the number of PHYs. To break a FlexE group into multiple (sub)groups, this API needs to be called multiple times. Similar to a FlexE group, a (sub)group can have n(1-6) PHYs. For example: a FlexE group having 6 PHYs needs to break into two (sub)groups, with 2 PHYs in one (sub)group and 4 PHYs in another. In this case this API needs to call twice and each time the PHY Ids belonging to the (sub)group needs to be listed in phys_chnl_id_X parameter. This function is mandatory for G5_FLEXE_MODE_OTN_AWARE mode and G5_FLEXE_MODE_PHY_AWARE modes and not applicable for any other modes of operation.The g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add() API has the following parameters:

The device_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add() API is the device instance.The chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add() API is a user specified channel ID for FlexE (sub)Group. The group_chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add() API is the channel ID for FlexE Group this is a sub group of.

The phy_chnl_id_X, where X = 0 to 5, parameters of the g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add() API are PHY IDs assigned to the FlexE (sub)Group. This is the logical order of PHYs in the (sub)group. If phy_chnl_id_X = G5_MAX_UINT32, then PHY X is not is assigned to the FlexE (sub)Group

section.title: g5_api_flexe_group_config()
section.p: The g5_api_flexe_group_config() API provisions and activates a bi-directional FlexE group. It has the following parameters:

The device_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_group_config() API is the device instance.The chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_group_config() API is a user specified channel ID for FlexE Group and matches the channel used in the associated FlexE Group's g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API call.

section.title: g5_api_flexe_client_prov()
section.p: The g5_api_flexe_client_prov() API used to provision a FlexE client to a FlexE group. This API associates the FlexE client to the FlexE group's calendar slots. This API can be used in an additive manner to provision Tx channel only or Rx channel only or both. The g5_api_flexe_client_prov() API has the following parameters and associated enumerated types :

The device_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_client_prov() API is the device instance.The chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add() API is a user specified channel ID for FlexE (sub)Group. The group_chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_subgroup_add() API is the channel ID for FlexE Group this is a sub group of.

The oduk_mapping_mode parameter of of the g5_api_flexe_client_prov() API is defined by the enumeration g5_oduk_mapping_mode_t. This parameter specifies the mapping mode for FlexE clients being transported over ODUk/ODUFlex and is not relevant and ignored for FlexE client being transported to the Interlaken packet interface. The enumerators are shown inTable 4 below.

entry.p: No ODUk mapping. This client is terminated to an Interlaken packet channel. The chnl_id for the Interlaken packet channel must be reused.
This is for a 64b/66b stream with all idles and alignment markers removed. The MAPOTN block uses G.709 17.11 IMP mapping to map the FlexE client to the ODUflex.
Only valid for 10GE mode, GFP packets mapped via Gsup43 Clause 6.2 into C49 serial stream padded with idles. MAPOTN uses G.7041 7.9 (GFP mapping) mapping of FlexE client to the ODU2.

This is for an Ethernet CBR stream with alignment markers. The MAPOTN block uses the OIF 7.2.2 mapping of FlexE client to the ODUflex. Depending on the FlexE client rate, the MAPOTN uses either BMP or GMP mapping. 2x 5G slots defines an ODU2e container size.
2x 5G slots defines an ODU1e container size.

section.p: The tx_flexe_client_number and rx_flexe_client_number parameters of of the g5_api_flexe_client_prov() API are 16 bit unique FlexE client numbers that are inserted to the 'Client calendar A' or 'Client calendar B' overhead field in Block #3 bit 1-16 or bit 17-32 of the FlexE overhead. Valid values for tx_flexe_client_number and rx_flexe_client_number are 0x1 - 0xFFFE. If provisioning only the Tx client, the rx_flex_client_number can be set to 0, and vice versa.

The FlexE client may be added to multiple bonded Ethernet PHYS within a group by specifying slots in more than one PHY by using the phy_tx_client_slots_X and phy_rx_client_slots_X, where X = 1 to 6, parameters of the g5_api_flexe_client_prov() API. These are a set of calendar slot locations across 6 logical PHYs to describe the calendar slots used by the FlexE client in each of the PHYs in the FlexE group. The number X of client_slots_X is the logical PHY number of the 100G port in the FlexE group. If provisioning the Tx client only, the phy_rx_client_slots_X can be set to 0, and vice versa. The PHY element order must match the PHY element order defined in g5_api_flexe_phy_add(). For example, if a FlexE client is using 2 calendar slots in logical PHY 0 and 10 calendar slots in logical PHY 1 to carry 60G data, this can be shown as phy_rx_client_slots_1 = 0x3; phy_rx_client_slots_2 = 0x3FF; phy_rx_client_slots_3 = 0; phy_rx_client_slots_4 = 0; phy_rx_client_slots_5 = 0; phy_rx_client_slots_6 = 0. When the FlexE group's calendar update mode is set to G5_FLEXE_CALENDAR_SLAVE_FORCE_MODE or G5_FLEXE_CALENDAR_SLAVE_ALARM_MODE in the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API, the FlexE_DEMUX will inherit the calendar slots from the Far End FlexE_MUX. At minimum, 'flexe_client_number' must be specified when provisioning the Rx FlexE client when the FlexE group's calendar update mode is either of the two SLAVE modes. When 'flexe_client_number' is provided, 'flexe_client_slots' of rx_client_data can be left as {0, 0, 0, 0, 0 ,0}. The g5_api_flexe_client_slots_get() API can be called to retrieve the received calendar slots advertised from the Far End FlexE_MUX.

section.title: g5_api_flexe_calendar_update()
section.p: The g5_api_flexe_calendar_update() API is used to switch the calendars for the FlexE Group to add/remove FlexE clients. It can work independently on either the MUX, DEMUX, or both. Note that the calendar update mode is selected by the calendar_update_mode parameter of the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API. See Table 3 above. The g5_api_flexe_calendar_update() API has the following parameters and associated enumerated types.

The device_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_calendar_update() API is the device instance.The group_chnl_id parameter of the g5_api_flexe_calendar_update() API is a unique identifier for the FlexE group. This was the number specified in the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API.

The cal_update_scope parameter is specified by the g5_flexe_calendar_update_mode_t enumeration for the g5_api_flexe_calendar_update() API and is the scope of calendar switch operation on the MUX, DEMUX, or both. The enumerators are shown in Table 5 below.

entry.p: Update occurs on the MUX only.
Update occurs on the DEMUX only.
Update occurs on MUX and DEMUX.

section.p: The ms_timer parameter of the g5_api_flexe_calendar_update() API is a timer for the MUX after changing the outgoing CR bit to the DEMUX. The recommended timeouts are a minimum of 15ms which is 3 complete transmissions of the calendar to the DEMUX. Upon a timeout, the action taken will be specified by calendar_update_mode in the g5_api_flexe_group_prov() API. This parameter is unused if calendar_update_mode is either STATIC mode, or NETWORK mode.
